decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | The flat roof to be created shall not be used to form a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area.  REASON:	To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5, B8 and H33, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1 and 5.5. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1and B5, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1 and 5.5. | The proposed rooflights in the side roofslope approved shall contain only obscure glass, and be permanently fixed shut.  A sample of the obscured glass, no smaller than 300 mm square shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development, and the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the sample thus approved.  The details so approved shall be retained permanently.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B5, B8 and H33, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1 and 5.5.
description: Raising of hip roof to form a gable end wall; extensions to roof to form a mansard roof to rear; 3 no. rooflights to front and 3 no. rooflights to side roofslopes of house
